segments.en: “Reverend, they speak of ‘extinguishment in the present life’.

segments.pli: Kittāvatā nu kho, āvuso, diṭṭhadhammanibbānaṃ vuttaṃ bhagavatā”ti?
segments.en: In what way did the Buddha speak of extinguishment in the present life?”

segments.pli: “Idhāvuso, bhikkhu vivicceva kāmehi … pe … paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
segments.en: “First, take a mendicant who, quite secluded from sensual pleasures … enters and remains in the first absorption.

segments.pli: Ettāvatāpi kho, āvuso, diṭṭhadhammanibbānaṃ vuttaṃ bhagavatā pariyāyena … pe ….
segments.en: To this extent the Buddha spoke of extinguishment in the present life in a qualified sense. …

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu sabbaso nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṃ samatikkamma saññāvedayitanirodhaṃ upasampajja viharati, paññāya cassa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇā honti.
segments.en: Furthermore, take a mendicant who, going totally beyond the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, enters and remains in the cessation of perception and feeling. And, having seen with wisdom, their defilements come to an end.

segments.pli: Ettāvatāpi kho, āvuso, diṭṭhadhammanibbānaṃ vuttaṃ bhagavatā nippariyāyenā”ti.
segments.en: To this extent the Buddha spoke of extinguishment in the present life in a definitive sense.”
